triples.name: Microbiome
triples.relevance: Paper studies microbiomes and how environmental stress affects their network properties and stability.

triples.name: Network theory
triples.relevance: Paper applies network theory concepts like modularity and cohesion to analyze microbial community structure.

triples.name: Modularity (networks)
triples.relevance: Modularity is one of two key network properties examined to measure microbial community stability.

triples.name: Ecological stability
triples.relevance: Paper investigates how environmental stress affects the stability of microbial communities using network properties.

triples.name: Soil microbiology
triples.relevance: Paper studies soil microbiomes along stress gradients in the Florida scrub ecosystem.

triples.name: Ecosystem services
triples.relevance: Paper emphasizes the importance of microbiomes for ecosystem services that may be undermined by increasing stress.

triples.name: Biodiversity
triples.relevance: Paper finds that prokaryotic and fungal diversity decline in high stress environments.

triples.name: Functional group (ecology)
triples.relevance: Paper analyzes changes in functional guilds such as oligotrophs, mutualists, and pathogenic taxa along stress gradients.

triples.name: Biological interaction
triples.relevance: Paper examines negative and positive biotic interactions as reflected in network cohesion patterns.

triples.name: Mutualism (biology)
triples.relevance: Paper finds that mutualistic interactions increase in relative abundance along stress gradients.

triples.name: Pathogen
triples.relevance: Paper observes that pathogenic taxa decrease in relative abundance in high stress environments.

triples.name: Oligotroph
triples.relevance: Paper identifies oligotrophs as organisms that increase in abundance under stress conditions.

triples.name: Stress gradient hypothesis
triples.relevance: Paper explicitly uses this theoretical framework to explain why negative biotic interactions decrease under stress.

triples.name: Structural cohesion
triples.relevance: Paper proposes using negative:positive cohesion ratio as a novel network metric to predict microbial community stability under environmental stress.
